alert.note: Alert for Loess Plains (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 29 at 2:18PM CDT until April 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR FIRE ZONE 219...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING FOR FIRE ZONE 219... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES AND STRONG WINDS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES AND STRONG WINDS... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity values and strong winds, which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Sunday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * TIMING...Noon until 8 PM CDT Saturday and from 1 PM CDT through 8 PM CDT Sunday. * WINDS...North 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph Saturday and north at 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent Saturday and as low as 14 percent Sunday. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 70s Saturday and mid 60s on Sunday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and be very difficult to control. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: * A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
